Subsection.Text: If the Division decides not to declare the claim abandoned, other than under subrule (2), it must start or continue the proceedings on the day the decision is made or as soon as possible after that day.
A party who wants to challenge the constitutional validity, applicability or operability of a legislative provision must complete a notice of constitutional question.
The party must complete the notice as set out in Form 69 of the Federal Courts Rules or any other form that includes

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the party’s name;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Division file number;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date, time and location of the hearing;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the specific legislative provision that is being challenged;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the material facts relied on to support the constitutional challenge; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a summary of the legal argument to be made in support of the constitutional challenge.

Subsection.Text: The party must provide

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of the notice to the Attorney General of Canada and to the attorney general of each province of Canada, in accordance with section 57 of the Federal Courts Act;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of the notice to the Minister;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of the notice to the other party, if any; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the original notice to the Division, together with a written statement indicating how and when the copies of the notice were provided under paragraphs (a) to (c), and proof that they were provided.

Subsection.Text: Documents provided under this rule must be received by their recipients no later than 10 days before the day on which the constitutional argument is made.

When the Division makes a decision, other than an interlocutory decision, it must provide in writing a notice of decision to the claimant or the protected person, as the case may be, and to the Minister.
The Division must provide written reasons for the decision together with the notice of decision

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if written reasons must be provided under paragraph 169(1)(d) of the Act;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the Minister was not present when the Division rendered an oral decision and reasons allowing a claim for refugee protection; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: when the Division makes a decision on an application to vacate or to cease refugee protection.

Subsection.Text: A request under paragraph 169(1)(e) of the Act for written reasons for a decision must be made in writing.

Section.MarginalNote: When decision of single member takes effect

Subsection.Text: A decision made by a single Division member allowing or rejecting a claim for refugee protection, on an application to vacate or to cease refugee protection, on the abandonment of a claim or of an application to vacate or to cease refugee protection, or allowing an application to withdraw a claim or to withdraw an application to vacate or to cease refugee protection takes effect

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if given orally at a hearing, when the member states the decision and gives the reasons; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if made in writing, when the member signs and dates the reasons for the decision.

Subsection.MarginalNote: When decision of three member panel takes effect
Subsection.Text: A decision made by a panel of three Division members allowing or rejecting a claim for refugee protection, on an application to vacate or to cease refugee protection, on the abandonment of a claim or of an application to vacate or to cease refugee protection, or allowing an application to withdraw a claim or to withdraw an application to vacate or to cease refugee protection takes effect

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if given orally at a hearing, when all the members state their decision and give their reasons; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if made in writing, when all the members sign and date their reasons for the decision.

Section.Text: In the absence of a provision in these Rules dealing with a matter raised during the proceedings, the Division may do whatever is necessary to deal with the matter.
The Division may, after giving the parties notice and an opportunity to object,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: act on its own initiative, without a party having to make an application or request to the Division;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: change a requirement of a rule;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: excuse a person from a requirement of a rule; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: extend a time limit, before or after the time limit has expired, or shorten it if the time limit has not expired.

Section.Text: Unless proceedings are declared invalid by the Division, a failure to follow any requirement of these Rules does not make the proceedings invalid.

These Rules come into force on the day on which section 26 of the Balanced Refugee Reform Act comes into force, but if they are registered after that day, they come into force on the day on which they are registered.
